A: Section A: Objective Questions
1. Adequate _ must be provided for computer systems (a) space (b) ventilation (c) light
2. To prevent damage, adequate _ must be allowed between each system unit (a) space (b) time (c) power
3. Avoiding _ is a basic security measure for computer systems (a) dust (b) light (c) sound
4. To care for a computer, one should avoid _ (a) moisture (b) heat (c) cold
5. Provision of an air conditioner is a step to care for a computer system (a) True (b) False
6. A fan is a cooling machine that helps care for a computer system (a) True (b) False
7. UPS and other appliances help avoid loss of information and electrical damages (a) True (b) False
8. Adequate care must be given to storage devices like diskettes (a) True (b) False
9. Zip disks are examples of storage devices that need adequate care (a) True (b) False
10. Flash drives are storage devices that require careful handling (a) True (b) False
11. CD writer drives are storage devices that need adequate care (a) True (b) False
12. An authorized user should be disallowed from having access to your computer (a) True (b) False
13. Maximum security should be ensured for file information on the computer (a) True (b) False
14. Providing a computer with an Anti-Virus program helps avoid _ (a) viruses (b) dust (c) moisture
15. Avoiding food particles near a computer is a care step (a) True (b) False
16. Unplugging the system when not in use for long periods is a good practice (a) True (b) False
17. One reason for taking care of a computer is to avoid _ (a) damage (b) cost (c) speed
18. Protecting the system is a reason for computer care (a) True (b) False
19. Taking care of a computer helps to prolong its _ (a) life (b) speed (c) size
20. Caring for a computer makes the user comfortable for maximum _ (a) efficiency (b) speed (c) comfort
21. Word processing software assists users in producing _ (a) documents (b) hardware (c) networks
22. Reports are examples of documents produced by word processing software (a) True (b) False
23. Letters can be created using word processing software (a) True (b) False
24. Papers are types of documents produced by word processing software (a) True (b) False
25. Manuscripts are documents that can be produced with word processing software (a) True (b) False
26. Microsoft Word is an example of word processing _ (a) software (b) hardware (c) network
27. Word Perfect is a type of word processing software (a) True (b) False
28. Word Star is an example of word processing software (a) True (b) False
29. Ami Pro is a word processing software example (a) True (b) False
30. Microsoft Word was developed by the _ company (a) Microsoft (b) Apple (c) Google
31. Microsoft Word enables users to prepare documents (a) True (b) False
32. Users can apply formats using Microsoft Word (a) True (b) False
33. Microsoft Word allows users to produce an output (a) True (b) False
34. Operations in Microsoft Word are simplified through the use of _ (a) menus (b) cables (c) printers
35. The use of tools simplifies operations in Microsoft Word (a) True (b) False
36. Extensive manipulation of the _ helps achieve desired results in Microsoft Word (a) mouse (b) keyboard (c) monitor
37. Letters can be created using Microsoft Word (a) True (b) False
38. Memorandums are jobs that can be done on Microsoft Word (a) True (b) False
39. Reports can be created using Microsoft Word (a) True (b) False
40. Tables can be created using Microsoft Word (a) True (b) False
41. Theses can be created using Microsoft Word (a) True (b) False
42. Journals can be created using Microsoft Word (a) True (b) False
43. Graphics can be created using Microsoft Word (a) True (b) False
44. Word Perfect is an _ word processing program (a) alternative (b) primary (c) outdated
45. Word processing programs can open documents created in each other (a) True (b) False
46. Microsoft Word can open a Word Perfect document (a) True (b) False
47. The Title bar is a component of the Word processing _ (a) environment (b) software (c) hardware
48. The Menu bar is a component of the Word processing environment (a) True (b) False
49. The Title bar shows the document/software application _ (a) name (b) size (c) date
50. The Menu bar can be used to activate _ of Microsoft Word features (a) commands (b) files (c) documents
B: 1. What is the topic discussed regarding computer maintenance? _________
2. What type of software assists users in producing documents? _________
4. What part of the Word processing environment shows the document/software application name? _________
5. What can be used to activate commands of Microsoft Word features? _________
C: 1. List two basic security measures to prevent damage to a computer system.
2. State two reasons for taking care of a computer.
3. Name two examples of word processing software.
4. List two types of documents that can be created using Microsoft Word.
5. Name two components of the Word processing environment.
answers_C: To avoid damage, To protect the system
